intro: Hieracium jordanii subsp. lacistum, commonly known as Jordan's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Middle East. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces yellow to orange disk flowers surrounded by pale green to white ray florets. This subspecies is notable for its limited distribution and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations.
